EN.definition: Outward or visible aspect of a person or thing
examples: There was a strange appearance in the sky.

UK.definition: Зовнішній вигляд об'єктів визначається через те яким чином вони відбивають і передають світло.

EN.definition: Fruit with red or yellow or green skin and sweet to tart crisp whitish flesh

PL.definition: Jabłko – jadalny, kulisty owoc drzew z rodzaju jabłoń Malus .

UK.definition: Яблуко — це плід яблуні, рослини з родини трояндових.

EN.definition: The act of bringing something to bear; using it for a particular purpose
examples: He advocated the application of statistics to the problem
A novel application of electronics to medical diagnosis

EN.definition: Put into service ; make work or employ for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose
examples: Use your head!
We only use Spanish at home
I can't use this tool
Apply a magnetic field here
This thinking was applied to many projects
How do you utilize this tool?
I apply this rule to get good results
Use the plastic bags to store the food
He doesn't know how to use a computer

PL.definition: Stosować jakiś obiekt, często aby osiągnąć pewien cel.

EN.definition: The act of putting a person into a non-elective position
examples: The appointment had to be approved by the whole committee
His appointment was deemed suitable.

EN.definition: Recognize with gratitude ; be grateful for
examples: I appreciate your efforts.

EN.definition: Ideas or actions intended to deal with a problem or situation
examples: His approach to every problem is to draw up a list of pros and cons
An attack on inflation
His plan of attack was misguided

EN.definition: Suitable for a particular person or place or condition etc
examples: A book not appropriate for children
A funeral conducted the appropriate solemnity
It seems that an apology is appropriate

EN.definition: The formal act of approving
examples: He gave the project his blessing
His decision merited the approval of any sensible person

EN.definition: Give sanction to
examples: I approve of his educational policies

EN.definition: The month following March and preceding May

PL.definition: Kwiecień – czwarty miesiąc w roku, według kalendarza gregoriańskiego ma 30 dni.

UK.definition: Кві́тень — четвертий місяць року в юліанському та григоріанському календарях.

EN.definition: Someone who creates plans to be used in making something (such as buildings )
examples: Plato made the causes of things to be matter, ideas, and an efficient architect.

PL.definition: Architekt – specjalista w dziedzinie projektowania i wznoszenia budowli, także inicjator i organizator czegoś..

UK.definition: Архіте́ктор, жін.

EN.definition: An architectural product or work
A particular geographical region of indefinite boundary ( usually serving some special purpose or distinguished by its people or culture or geography )
examples: It was a mountainous area
Bible country

PL.definition: Pole powierzchni – miara przyporządkowująca danej figurze nieujemną liczbę w pewnym sensie charakteryzującą jej rozmiar.

UK.definition: Пло́ща — фізична величина, що визначає розмір поверхні, одна з основних властивостей геометричних фігур, у математиці розглядається як міра множини точок, які займають поверхню або якусь її частину.

EN.definition: Present reasons and arguments
examples: He argued his point.
He argued that America should stop Lend-Lease convoying because it needed to fortify its own Army with the supplies.
I reasoned the matter with my friend.

EN.definition: A fact or assertion offered as evidence that something is true
examples: It was a strong argument that his hypothesis was true

PL.definition: Fakt lub stwierdzenie oferowane jako dowód na to, że coś jest prawdziwe.

EN.definition: Come into existence ; take on form or shape
examples: A new religious movement originated in that country
A love that sprang up from friendship
The idea for the book grew out of a short story
An interesting phenomenon uprose
The scheme originated with the governor and council.
A cloud arose and covered the sun.

EN.definition: A human limb ; technically the part of the superior limb between the shoulder and the elbow but commonly used to refer to the whole superior limb
examples: The arm and forearm are parts of the upper limb in the human body.

UK.definition: Рука́ — кожна з двох верхніх кінцівок людини і мавпи, від плечового суглоба до кінчиків пальців.

EN.definition: (used of persons or the military) characterized by having or bearing arms
examples: Armed robbery

EN.definition: Weapons considered collectively
A permanent organization of the military land forces of a nation or state
examples: The army was sent in to quell the uprising.

PL.definition: Wojska lądowe – rodzaj sił zbrojnych przeznaczony do wykonywania zadań operacyjnych przede wszystkim na obszarach lądowych.

UK.definition: А́рмія (фр.

EN.definition: In the area or vicinity
examples: A few spectators standing about
Hanging around
Waited around for the next flight

EN.definition: Put into a proper or systematic order
examples: Arrange the books on the shelves in chronological order

EN.definition: The thing arranged or agreed to
examples: They made arrangements to meet in Chicago

EN.definition: The act of apprehending (especially apprehending a criminal)
examples: The policeman on the beat got credit for the collar

PL.definition: Areszt – ogólna nazwa rodziny instytucji, a zarazem środków karnych znanych różnym gałęziom prawa, których cechę wspólną stanowi przymusowe odizolowanie poddanej mu osoby od świata zewnętrznego.

UK.definition: Арешт — кримінальне покарання, що полягає в триманні засудженого військовослужбовця в умовах ізоляції на гауптвахті і встановлюється на строк від одного до шести місяців.

EN.definition: Accomplishment of an objective
examples: The arrival of the railway made the local tourist industry viable.

PL.definition: Arrival – utwór instrumentalny szwedzkiego zespołu ABBA , pochodzący z albumu pod tym samym tytułem.

EN.definition: Reach a destination ; arrive by movement or progress
examples: She arrived home at 7 o'clock
She didn't get to Chicago until after midnight

EN.definition: The products of human creativity ; works of art collectively
examples: An art exhibition
A fine collection of art
A collection of fine art

EN.definition: Nonfictional prose forming an independent part of a publication

PL.definition: Artykuł prasowy – ogólna nazwa drukowanej wypowiedzi w prasie, od notatki informacyjnej na temat polityczny, społeczny, kulturalny, sportowy – po krótki esej.

UK.definition: Стаття — це жанр журналістики , в якому автор ставить завдання проаналізувати суспільні ситуації, процеси, явища, перш за все з точки зору закономірностей, що лежать в їх основі.

EN.definition: Contrived by art rather than nature
examples: Artificial flowers
Artificial flavoring
An artificial diamond
Artificial fibers
Artificial sweeteners

EN.definition: A person whose creative work shows sensitivity and imagination

PL.definition: Artysta

UK.definition: Мите́ць — людина, яка займається творчою діяльністю в будь-якому виді мистецтва.

EN.definition: Relating to or characteristic of art or artists
examples: His artistic background

EN.definition: To the same degree (often followed by `as')
examples: They were equally beautiful
Birds were singing and the child sang as sweetly
Sang as sweetly as a nightingale
He is every bit as mean as she is

EN.definition: Feeling shame or guilt or embarrassment or remorse
examples: Are you ashamed for having lied?
Felt ashamed of my torn coat

EN.definition: Inquire about
examples: I asked about their special today
He had to ask directions several times
